text: Under contract law in some legal systems, a redhibitory defect is a hidden defect that prevents a product from performing the task for which it was purchased. A buyer of a product if a redhibitory defect can be entitled to a redhibition (also called redhibitiory action). In the United States, this is a legal concept unique to the state of Louisiana. ==References== Category:Louisiana law Category:Contract law
title: Redhibitory defect
